I had the same issue. How about adding some noise to precalculated bottlenecks?

I'm not sure if this would work, but adding a random vector to each precalculated bottleneck before training with them is cheap enougth. Since those bottlenecks are in the end a feature vector over which there is a linear classifier, it makes sense for me... doesn't it?
